caption.text:
Nobody knows who originally designed the white plastic chair. Yet, numerous remakes are patented. Pierre Castignola @pierrecastignola (BA Man and Leisure '18 Cum Laude) had a take on intellectual property in his project 'Copytopia' using one of the most democratic designs of our time to reclaim creation: the ubiquitous white plastic chair. He explains that even though the world is full of copyrights, the system no longer works. Instead of protecting creators and inventors, they are now limiting the creative process. We should be able to improve on existing designs, Pierre Castignola believes. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
